body_html: @Sri06006 I was also able to get things working by installing CUDA 9.0. I installed it along side CUDA 9.2 since I was told they can coexist. Things are working, but I still think it's odd that the whl file's description would say it has CUDA 9.2 support if it only explicitly looks for CUDA 9.0.
body_text: @Sri06006 I was also able to get things working by installing CUDA 9.0. I installed it along side CUDA 9.2 since I was told they can coexist. Things are working, but I still think it's odd that the whl file's description would say it has CUDA 9.2 support if it only explicitly looks for CUDA 9.0.
body: @Sri06006 I was also able to get things working by installing CUDA 9.0. I installed it along side CUDA 9.2 since I was told they can coexist. Things are working, but I still think it's odd that the whl file's description would say it has CUDA 9.2 support if it only explicitly looks for CUDA 9.0.
